name: Yellowstone National Park
description: Yellowstone National Park, established in 1872 as the first national park in the United States and widely considered the first in the world, is known for its extraordinary geothermal features, diverse wildlife, and stunning landscapes. The park encompasses lakes, canyons, rivers, and mountain ranges, and sits atop one of the largest active volcanic systems on Earth — the Yellowstone Caldera.

geology.summary: The park lies over the Yellowstone Caldera, a supervolcano formed during a massive eruption approximately 640,000 years ago. Geothermal activity continues today, with over 10,000 hydrothermal features, including geysers, hot springs, mudpots, and fumaroles.

wildlife.description: Yellowstone hosts one of the largest nearly intact temperate ecosystems in the world, home to over 60 species of mammals and 300 species of birds.

locations.name: Old Faithful
locations.description: World-famous cone geyser erupting every 90 minutes on average, with eruptions reaching up to 56 meters.

locations.name: Grand Prismatic Spring
locations.description: The largest hot spring in the United States, known for its vivid colors caused by thermophilic bacteria.

locations.name: Yellowstone Lake
locations.description: One of the largest high-altitude lakes in North America, at an elevation of 2,357 meters, with geothermal features along its floor.

locations.name: Mammoth Hot Springs
locations.description: Travertine terraces formed by hot water from the Norris–Mammoth Corridor rising through limestone.

locations.name: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone
locations.description: A 32-kilometer canyon carved by the Yellowstone River, featuring the Lower and Upper Falls, with striking yellow, red, and orange rock walls.

routes.name: Upper Geyser Basin Loop
routes.description: Boardwalk trail connecting several geysers including Old Faithful, Castle, and Grand Geyser.

routes.name: Mount Washburn Trail
routes.description: A scenic and moderately strenuous trail leading to panoramic views from the summit of Mount Washburn.

routes.name: Uncle Tom’s Trail
routes.description: Steep descent of 328 steps leading to an overlook of the Lower Falls in the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone.

safety_tips: Stay on designated boardwalks and trails in geothermal areas.
Keep at least 23 meters (75 feet) from all wildlife, and 91 meters (300 feet) from bears and wolves.
Do not approach or feed animals.
Be prepared for rapidly changing weather conditions.
Carry bear spray in backcountry areas.
